qas.question: In 1763 what was the status of Frederick?

answers.text: his kingdom was devastated and his army severely weakened

qas.question: In 1763 what was the status of Austria?

answers.text: facing a severe financial crisis and had to decrease the size of its army

qas.question: What had happened to Frederick's financial help from Britain?

answers.text: British subsidies had been stopped by the new Prime Minister Lord Bute

qas.question: What had happened to Frederick's extra troops from Russia?

answers.text: Catherine, who ended Russia's alliance with Prussia and withdrew from the war

qas.question: What was the result of the weakening of both Prussia and Austria?

answers.text: In 1763 a peace settlement was reached at the Treaty of Hubertusburg, ending the war in central Europe.

context: By 1763, the war in Central Europe was essentially a stalemate. Frederick had retaken most of Silesia and Saxony but not the latter's capital, Dresden. His financial situation was not dire, but <a0_0>his kingdom was devastated and his army severely weakened<a0_0/>. His manpower had dramatically decreased, and he had lost so many effective officers and generals that a new offensive was perhaps impossible. <a2_0>British subsidies had been stopped by the new Prime Minister Lord Bute<a2_0/>, and the Russian Emperor had been overthrown by his wife, <a3_0>Catherine, who ended Russia's alliance with Prussia and withdrew from the war<a3_0/>. Austria, however, like most participants, was <a1_0>facing a severe financial crisis and had to decrease the size of its army<a1_0/>, something which greatly affected its offensive power. Indeed, after having effectively sustained a long war, its administration was in disarray. By that time, it still held Dresden, the southeastern parts of Saxony, the county of Glatz, and southern Silesia, but the prospect of victory was dim without Russian support. <a4_0>In 1763 a peace settlement was reached at the Treaty of Hubertusburg, ending the war in central Europe.
